content: 1. It shall be the duty of the board of supervisors of elections to provide for each special and general election a suitable place or places for voting and suitable ballot boxes and ballots or voting machines. The ballots or voting machines shall show the name of each candidate nominated for elective office in accordance with the provisions of this Charter, arranged in alphabetical order by office with no party designation of any kind.

1. The board of supervisors of elections shall keep the polls open from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. unless the council, by resolution, shall fix longer or shorter hours. In the event of extraordinary circumstances on Election Day, the board of supervisors of elections shall have the authority to extend the hours the polls are open at one or more voting location.

1. It shall be unlawful for any electioneering activities to occur within twenty-five (25) feet from the main entrance of a polling place. The chief election judge at each polling place may modify this distance if required to protect the safety or welfare of individuals electioneering or voting.
title: Election procedures.
